title: Authors and Citation
text: Ryan Zomorrodi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zomorrodi R (2025). socratadata: Explore Socrata Data Ease. R package version 0.1.0.9002, https://ryanzomorrodi.github.io/socratadata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {socratadata: Explore Socrata Data with Ease},   author = {Ryan Zomorrodi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9002},   url = {https://ryanzomorrodi.github.io/socratadata/}, }

title: Explore Socrata Data with Ease
text: Explore Socrata data ease. socratadata provides easy--use interface downloading data Socrata open data portals powered Rust. socratadata improves upon existing RSocrata package introducing support Socrata Discovery API Socrata datatypes. Unlike RSocrata, socratadata support uploading editing existing datasets.

title: Explore Socrata Data with Ease
text: can install socratadata CRAN. can install development version socratadata GitHub :

title: Explore Socrata Data with Ease
text: Use soc_discover() explore datasets domain. query. categories. tags. ids.

title: Explore Socrata Data with Ease
text: socratadata supports unauthenticated requests via v2.1 API. , however, recommended obtain api key make code future-proof. soc_read() automatically authenticate "soc_api_key_id" "soc_api_key_secret" environment variables. can create .Renviron file add keys like : retrieve keys using Use soc_read() read socrata dataset R. Spatial data read sf object. can even perform complex queries using Socrata Query Language (SoQL) via soc_query().
code: soc_api_key_id="your_id_here" soc_api_key_secret="your_secret_here" Sys.getenv("soc_api_key_id") #> [1] "your_id_here" Sys.getenv("soc_api_key_secret") #> [1] "your_secret_here" soc_read(   "https://data.cityofchicago.org/Transportation/CTA-Ridership-Daily-Boarding-Totals/6iiy-9s97/about_data" ) #> # A tibble: 8,886 × 9 #>    service_date        day_type    bus rail_boardings total_rides `:id`          #>    <dttm>              <chr>     <dbl>          <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>          #>  1 2001-01-01 00:00:00 U        297192         126455      423647 row-pux9_24p6… #>  2 2001-01-02 00:00:00 W        780827         501952     1282779 row-ekyk_7mqh… #>  3 2001-01-03 00:00:00 W        824923         536432     1361355 row-7knw-h4az… #>  4 2001-01-04 00:00:00 W        870021         550011     1420032 row-xnam~m72f… #>  5 2001-01-05 00:00:00 W        890426         557917     1448343 row-7pqj-uxkc… #>  6 2001-01-06 00:00:00 A        577401         255356      832757 row-kvuw~shzc… #>  7 2001-01-07 00:00:00 U        375831         169825      545656 row-3f5d.axqe… #>  8 2001-01-08 00:00:00 W        985221         590706     1575927 row-mxrr.356r… #>  9 2001-01-09 00:00:00 W        978377         599905     1578282 row-i9ii.759a… #> 10 2001-01-10 00:00:00 W        984884         602052     1586936 row-fedk_g2kd… #> # ℹ 8,876 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: `:version` <chr>, `:created_at` <dttm>, #> #   `:updated_at` <dttm> soc_read(   "https://data.cityofchicago.org/Facilities-Geographic-Boundaries/Boundaries-Community-Areas/igwz-8jzy/about_data" ) #> Simple feature collection with 77 features and 9 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.94011 ymin: 41.64454 xmax: -87.52414 ymax: 42.02304 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 77 × 10 #>                              the_geom area_numbe community area_num_1 shape_area #>  *                 <MULTIPOLYGON [°]>      <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           <dbl> #>  1 (((-87.65456 41.99817, -87.65574 …          1 ROGERS P… 1           51259902. #>  2 (((-87.68465 42.01948, -87.68464 …          2 WEST RID… 2           98429095. #>  3 (((-87.64102 41.9548, -87.644 41.…          3 UPTOWN    3           65095643. #>  4 (((-87.67441 41.9761, -87.6744 41…          4 LINCOLN … 4           71352328. #>  5 (((-87.67336 41.93234, -87.67342 …          5 NORTH CE… 5           57054168. #>  6 (((-87.64102 41.9548, -87.64101 4…          6 LAKE VIEW 6           87214799. #>  7 (((-87.63182 41.93258, -87.63182 …          7 LINCOLN … 7           88316400. #>  8 (((-87.62446 41.91157, -87.62459 …          8 NEAR NOR… 8           76675896. #>  9 (((-87.80676 42.00084, -87.80676 …          9 EDISON P… 9           31636314. #> 10 (((-87.78002 41.99741, -87.78049 …         10 NORWOOD … 10         121959105. #> # ℹ 67 more rows #> # ℹ 5 more variables: shape_len <dbl>, `:id` <chr>, `:version` <chr>, #> #   `:created_at` <dttm>, `:updated_at` <dttm> lower_west_side <- soc_read(   "https://data.cityofchicago.org/Facilities-Geographic-Boundaries/Boundaries-Community-Areas/igwz-8jzy/about_data",   query = soc_query(     where = "community LIKE 'LOWER WEST SIDE'"   ) ) print(lower_west_side) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 9 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.68807 ymin: 41.8348 xmax: -87.63516 ymax: 41.86002 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>                    the_geom area_numbe community area_num_1 shape_area shape_len #> *        <MULTIPOLYGON [°]>      <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 (((-87.63516 41.85772, -…         31 LOWER WE… 31          81550724.    43229. #> # ℹ 4 more variables: `:id` <chr>, `:version` <chr>, `:created_at` <dttm>, #> #   `:updated_at` <dttm>  cta_ridership <- soc_read(   "https://data.cityofchicago.org/Transportation/Taxi-Trips-2013-2023-/wrvz-psew/about_data",   query = soc_query(     select = "pickup_community_area, count(*) as n",     where = glue::glue(       "within_polygon(dropoff_centroid_location, '{sf::st_as_text(lower_west_side$the_geom)}')"     ),     group_by = "pickup_community_area",     order_by = "n DESC"   ) ) print(cta_ridership) #> # A tibble: 78 × 2 #>    pickup_community_area      n #>                    <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1                    32 127474 #>  2                     8 113797 #>  3                    28  90983 #>  4                    31  39509 #>  5                    24  37789 #>  6                    33  22793 #>  7                    76  18006 #>  8                     6  15160 #>  9                    56  14142 #> 10                     7  12191 #> # ℹ 68 more rows

title: Explore Socrata Data with Ease
text: Access dataset’s metadata using soc_metadata(). explore dataset’s metadata using ’s url.
code: soc_metadata(cta_ridership) #> ID: wrvz-psew #> Name: Taxi Trips (2013-2023) #> Attribution: City of Chicago #> Owner: Jonathan Levy #> Provenance: official #> Description: This dataset ends with 2023. Please see the Featured Content #> link below for the dataset that starts in 2024. Taxi trips from 2013 to #> 2023 reported to the City of Chicago in its role as a regulatory agency. To #> protect privacy but allow for aggregate analyses, the Taxi ID is consistent for #> any given taxi medallion number but does not show the number, Census Tracts are #> suppressed in some cases, and times are rounded to the nearest 15 minutes. Due #> to the data reporting process, not all trips are reported but the City believes #> that most are. #> Created: 2016-05-27 21:27:48 #> Data last updated: 2024-02-07 20:40:12 #> Metadata last Updated: 2024-06-21 17:06:18 #> Domain Category: Transportation #> Domain Tags: taxis, transportation, and historical #> Domain fields: #> • Time Period: 2013 - 2023 #> • Changes and Other Historical Information Useful to Understanding This #> Dataset: #> https://www.google.com/search?as_q="Related+dataset+ID+s"+"wrvz-psew"+inurl:stories&as_sitesearch=data.cityofchicago.org #> • Data Owner: Department of Business Affairs & Consumer Protection #> Columns: #> # A tibble: 24 × 4 #> column_name column_label column_datatype column_description #> #> 1 trip_id Trip ID text A unique identifi… #> 2 taxi_id Taxi ID text A unique identifi… #> 3 trip_start_timestamp Trip Start Time… calendar_date When the trip sta… #> 4 trip_end_timestamp Trip End Timest… calendar_date When the trip end… #> 5 trip_seconds Trip Seconds number Time of the trip … #> 6 trip_miles Trip Miles number Distance of the t… #> 7 pickup_census_tract Pickup Census T… text The Census Tract … #> 8 dropoff_census_tract Dropoff Census … text The Census Tract … #> 9 pickup_community_area Pickup Communit… number The Community Are… #> 10 dropoff_community_area Dropoff Communi… number The Community Are… #> 11 fare Fare number The fare for the … #> 12 tips Tips number The tip for the t… #> 13 tolls Tolls number The tolls for the… #> 14 extras Extras number Extra charges for… #> 15 trip_total Trip Total number Total cost of the… #> 16 payment_type Payment Type text Type of payment f… #> 17 company Company text The taxi company. #> 18 pickup_centroid_latitude Pickup Centroid… number The latitude of t… #> 19 pickup_centroid_longitude Pickup Centroid… number The longitude of … #> 20 pickup_centroid_location Pickup Centroid… point The location of t… #> # ℹ 4 more rows #> Permalink: https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/wrvz-psew #> Link: #> https://data.cityofchicago.org/Transportation/Taxi-Trips-2013-2023-/wrvz-psew #> License: See Terms of Use soc_metadata( "https://data.cityofchicago.org/Transportation/CTA-Ridership-Daily-Boarding-Totals/6iiy-9s97/about_data" ) #> ID: 6iiy-9s97 #> Name: CTA - Ridership - Daily Boarding Totals #> Attribution: Chicago Transit Authority #> Owner: CTA #> Provenance: official #> Description: This dataset shows systemwide boardings for both bus and rail #> services provided by CTA, dating back to 2001. Daytypes are as follows: W = #> Weekday, A = Saturday, U = Sunday/Holiday. See attached readme file for #> information on how these numbers are calculated. #> Created: 2011-08-12 15:40:31 #> Data last updated: 2025-06-30 18:44:33 #> Metadata last Updated: 2025-06-30 18:44:32 #> Domain Category: Transportation #> Domain Tags: cta, public transit, and ridership #> Domain fields: #> • Data Owner: Chicago Transit Authority #> Columns: #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #> column_name column_label column_datatype column_description #> #> 1 service_date service_date calendar_date "" #> 2 day_type day_type text "" #> 3 bus bus number "" #> 4 rail_boardings rail_boardings number "" #> 5 total_rides total_rides number "" #> Permalink: https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/6iiy-9s97 #> Link: #> https://data.cityofchicago.org/Transportation/CTA-Ridership-Daily-Boarding-Totals/6iiy-9s97 #> License: See Terms of Use

what: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
title: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
text: Provides access Socrata Discovery API, allowing search tens thousands government datasets assets published Socrata platform. Governments levels publish data topics including crime, permits, finance, healthcare, research, performance.

title: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
code: soc_discover(   attribution = NULL,   categories = NULL,   domain_category = NULL,   domains = NULL,   ids = NULL,   names = NULL,   only = "dataset",   provenance = NULL,   query = NULL,   tags = NULL,   domain_tags = NULL,   location = "us",   limit = 10000 )

title: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
text: attribution string; Filter attribution publisher categories character vector; Filter categories. domain_category string; Filter domain category (requires specified domain). domains character vector; Filter domains. ids character vector; Filter asset IDs. names character vector; Filter asset names. character vector; Filter specific asset types. Must one : "chart", "dataset", "filter", "link", "map", "measure", "story", "system_dataset", "visualization". Default "dataset". provenance string; Filter provenance: "official" "community". query character string; Filter using token matching one asset's name, description, category, tags, column names, column fieldnames, column descriptions attribution. tags character vector; Filter tags associated assets. domain_tags string; Filter domain tags associated assets (requires specified domain). location string; Regional API domain: "us" (default) "eu". limit whole number; Maximum number results (exceed 10,000).

title: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
text: tibble containing metadata discovered asset. Columns include: id Asset identifier (four--four ID). name Asset name. attribution Attribution publisher asset. owner_name Display name asset owner. provenance Provenance asset (official community). description Textual description asset. created Date asset created. data_last_updated Date asset data last updated metadata_last_updated Date asset metadata last updated categories Category labels assigned asset. tags Tags associated asset. domain_category Category label assigned domain. domain_tags Tags applied domain. domain_metadata Metadata associated asset assigned domain. column_names Names asset columns. column_labels Labels asset columns. column_datatypes Datatypes asset columns. column_descriptions Description asset columns. permalink Permanent URL asset can accessed. link Direct asset link. license License associated asset.

title: Discover datasets and public data assets using the Socrata Discovery API — soc_discover
code: # \donttest{ # Search for crime-related datasets in the Public Safety category results <- soc_discover(   query = "crime",   categories = "Public Safety",   only = "dataset" ) # }

what: List Available Datasets on a Socrata Portal — soc_list
title: List Available Datasets on a Socrata Portal — soc_list
text: Retrieves catalog available datasets Socrata open data portal.

title: List Available Datasets on a Socrata Portal — soc_list
List Available Datasets on a Socrata Portal — soc_list
text: url character string specifying base URL Socrata portal (e.g., "https://data.cityofchicago.org").

title: List Available Datasets on a Socrata Portal — soc_list
text: tibble one row per dataset following columns: id Dataset identifier (four--four ID). name Title dataset. categories Categories associated dataset. keywords Keywords describing dataset. last_updated date last dataset modification. landing_page landing page url dataset. description Brief description dataset's content.

title: Extract Socrata Dataset Metadata — soc_metadata
text: Retrieves metadata attributes tibble returned soc_read() using dataset url, including dataset-level information column-level descriptions.

title: Extract Socrata Dataset Metadata — soc_metadata
text: dataset tibble returned soc_read() url.

title: Extract Socrata Dataset Metadata — soc_metadata
text: object class soc_meta, includes: id Asset identifier (four--four ID). name Asset name. attribution Attribution publisher asset. owner_name Display name asset owner. provenance Provenance asset (official community). description Textual description asset. created Date asset created. data_last_updated Date asset data last updated metadata_last_updated Date asset metadata last updated domain_category Category label assigned domain. domain_tags Tags applied domain. domain_metadata Metadata associated asset assigned domain. columns dataframe following columns: column_name Names asset columns. column_label Labels asset columns. column_datatype Datatypes asset columns. column_description Description asset columns. permalink Permanent URL asset can accessed. link Direct asset link. license License associated asset.

title: Extract Socrata Dataset Metadata — soc_metadata
text: function pulls descriptive metadata dataset's ID, title, attribution, category, creation update timestamps, description, domain-specific fields, field descriptions defined data provider.

title: Extract Socrata Dataset Metadata — soc_metadata
code: # \donttest{ url <- "https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc/" data <- soc_read(url, soc_query(limit = 1000L)) #> ℹ Utilizing v2.1 API. `include_synthetic_cols` will be ignored. Provide an `api_key_id` and `api_key_secret` to perform a v3 request. metadata <- soc_metadata(data) print(metadata) #> ID: 3wfw-mdbc #> Name: USGS Earthquakes 2012-11-08 #> Attribution: #> Owner: Chris Metcalf #> Provenance: official #> Description: #> Created: 2012-11-08 19:44:56 #> Data last updated: 2013-06-06 19:16:18 #> Metadata last Updated: 2013-06-06 18:51:32 #> Domain Category: #> Domain Tags: #> Domain fields: #> Columns: #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    column_name                 column_label       column_datatype #>    <chr>                       <chr>              <chr>           #>  1 source                      Source             text            #>  2 earthquake_id               Earthquake ID      text            #>  3 version                     Version            text            #>  4 datetime                    Datetime           calendar_date   #>  5 magnitude                   Magnitude          number          #>  6 depth                       Depth              number          #>  7 number_of_stations          Number of Stations number          #>  8 region                      Region             text            #>  9 location                    Location           location        #> 10 :@computed_region_k83t_ady5 Zip Codes          number          #> Permalink: https://soda.demo.socrata.com/d/3wfw-mdbc #> Link: #> https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc #> License:  metadata <- soc_metadata(url) print(metadata) #> ID: 3wfw-mdbc #> Name: USGS Earthquakes 2012-11-08 #> Attribution: #> Owner: Chris Metcalf #> Provenance: official #> Description: #> Created: 2012-11-08 19:44:56 #> Data last updated: 2013-06-06 19:16:18 #> Metadata last Updated: 2013-06-06 18:51:32 #> Domain Category: #> Domain Tags: #> Domain fields: #> Columns: #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    column_name                 column_label       column_datatype #>    <chr>                       <chr>              <chr>           #>  1 source                      Source             text            #>  2 earthquake_id               Earthquake ID      text            #>  3 version                     Version            text            #>  4 datetime                    Datetime           calendar_date   #>  5 magnitude                   Magnitude          number          #>  6 depth                       Depth              number          #>  7 number_of_stations          Number of Stations number          #>  8 region                      Region             text            #>  9 location                    Location           location        #> 10 :@computed_region_k83t_ady5 Zip Codes          number          #> Permalink: https://soda.demo.socrata.com/d/3wfw-mdbc #> Link: #> https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc #> License: # }

what: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
title: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
text: Constructs structured representation Socrata Query Language (SOQL) query can used Socrata API endpoints. function execute query; creates object can passed request functions printed inspection.

title: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
code: soc_query(   select = "*",   where = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   having = NULL,   order_by = NULL,   limit = NULL )

title: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
text: select string; Columns retrieve. string; Filter conditions. group_by string; Fields group . string; Conditions apply grouped records. order_by string; Sort order. limit whole number; maximum number records return.

title: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
text: object class soc_query, prints readable format can used build query URLs.

title: Build a Socrata Query Object — soc_query
code: query <- soc_query(   select = "region, avg(magnitude) as avg_magnitude, count(*) as count",   group_by = "region",   having = "count >= 5",   order_by = "avg_magnitude DESC" ) print(query) #> SELECT region, avg(magnitude) as avg_magnitude, count(*) as count #> GROUP BY region #> HAVING count >= 5 #> ORDER BY avg_magnitude DESC  # \donttest{ earthquakes_by_region <- soc_read(   "https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc/",   query = query ) #> ℹ Utilizing v2.1 API. `include_synthetic_cols` will be ignored. Provide an `api_key_id` and `api_key_secret` to perform a v3 request. # }

what: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
title: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
text: Downloads parses dataset Socrata open data portal URL, returning tibble sf object. Metadata also returned attributes returned object.

title: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
code: soc_read(   url,   query = soc_query(),   alias = "label",   page_size = 10000,   include_synthetic_cols = TRUE,   api_key_id = NULL,   api_key_secret = NULL )

title: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
text: url string; URL Socrata dataset. query string soc_query(); Query parameters specification alias string; Use field alias values. three options: "label": field alias values assigned label attribute field. "replace": field alias values replace existing column names. "drop": field alias values replace existing column names. page_size whole number; Maximum number rows returned per request. include_synthetic_cols logical; synthetic columns included? api_key_id string; API key ID authenticate requests. (Can also stored "soc_api_key_id" environment variable) api_key_secret string; API key secret authenticate requests. (Can also stored "soc_api_key_secret" environment variable)

title: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
text: tibble additional attributes containing dataset metadata. dataset contains single non-nested geospatial field, returned sf object. returned object following attributes: id Asset identifier (four--four ID). name Asset name. attribution Attribution publisher asset. owner_name Display name asset owner. provenance Provenance asset (official community). description Textual description asset. created Date asset created. data_last_updated Date asset data last updated metadata_last_updated Date asset metadata last updated domain_category Category label assigned domain. domain_tags Tags applied domain. domain_metadata Metadata associated asset assigned domain. columns dataframe following columns: column_name Names asset columns. column_label Labels asset columns. column_datatype Datatypes asset columns. column_description Description asset columns. permalink Permanent URL asset can accessed. link Direct asset link. license License associated asset.

title: Read a Socrata Dataset into R — soc_read
code: # \donttest{ soc_read(   "https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc/" ) #> ℹ Utilizing v2.1 API. `include_synthetic_cols` will be ignored. Provide an `api_key_id` and `api_key_secret` to perform a v3 request. #> ⠙ iterating 1 done (0.27/s) | 3.8s #> ⠙ iterating 2 done (0.51/s) | 3.9s #> # A tibble: 1,935 × 10 #>    source earthquake_id version datetime            magnitude depth #>    <chr>  <chr>         <chr>   <dttm>                  <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 uu     09101857      2       2012-09-10 18:57:30       2.2   0.9 #>  2 uu     09081656      2       2012-09-08 16:56:06       2.7   1.2 #>  3 ak     10555601      2       2012-09-10 13:16:13       1.1  11.6 #>  4 nc     71839715      2       2012-09-08 17:12:28       1     2.2 #>  5 uu     09140856      2       2012-09-14 08:56:35       2.3   0.1 #>  6 ak     10503556      2       2012-07-01 02:01:00       2.5   1   #>  7 hv     60365026      1       2012-06-28 12:06:00       1.7   8.6 #>  8 ci     11131234      0       2012-07-03 08:12:00       1.1  10.2 #>  9 hv     60365151      1       2012-06-29 00:26:00       1.8  11.8 #> 10 ak     10502928      2       2012-06-29 17:12:00       2    96.8 #> # ℹ 1,925 more rows #> # ℹ 4 more variables: number_of_stations <dbl>, region <chr>, #> #   location <tibble[,5]>, `:@computed_region_k83t_ady5` <dbl>  soc_read(   "https://soda.demo.socrata.com/dataset/USGS-Earthquakes-2012-11-08/3wfw-mdbc/",   soc_query(     select = "region, avg(magnitude) as avg_magnitude, count(*) as count",     group_by = "region",     having = "count >= 5",     order_by = "avg_magnitude DESC"   ) ) #> ℹ Utilizing v2.1 API. `include_synthetic_cols` will be ignored. Provide an `api_key_id` and `api_key_secret` to perform a v3 request. #> # A tibble: 40 × 3 #>    region                                avg_magnitude count #>    <chr>                                         <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Kuril Islands                                  5.32     5 #>  2 northern Xinjiang, China                       4.87     6 #>  3 south of Java, Indonesia                       4.86     9 #>  4 Tonga                                          4.85     6 #>  5 near the east coast of Honshu, Japan           4.72    10 #>  6 Costa Rica                                     4.66     5 #>  7 Dominican Republic region                      3.25     6 #>  8 Virgin Islands region                          3.11    47 #>  9 Puerto Rico region                             2.92    18 #> 10 Rat Islands, Aleutian Islands, Alaska          2.77    21 #> # ℹ 30 more rows # }

title: socratadata 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-29 Initial CRAN submission.
